item.title: Announcing the General Availability of GPT-4 Turbo with Vision on Azure OpenAI Service
item.description: We are thrilled to announce the general availability of GPT-4 Turbo with Vision on the Azure OpenAI Service, which processes both text and image inputs and replaces several preview models. This multimodal model has already been used by customers in various industries to enhance efficiencies and innovate, with case studies to be featured at the upcoming Build conference. For deployment details and future enhancements, including JSON mode and function calling for image inputs, please refer to our Azure OpenAI Service resources and updates.

atom:content.#text: We are thrilled to announce the general availability of GPT-4 Turbo with Vision on the Azure OpenAI Service, which processes both text and image inputs and replaces several preview models. This multimodal model has already been used by customers in various industries to enhance efficiencies and innovate, with case studies to be featured at the upcoming Build conference. For deployment details and future enhancements, including JSON mode and function calling for image inputs, please refer to our Azure OpenAI Service resources and updates.

item.title: General Availability - Azure API Center
item.description: Azure API Center is now generally available, providing a centralized solution to manage the challenges of API sprawl, which is exacerbated by the rapid proliferation of APIs and AI solutions. Azure API Center offers a unified inventory for seamless discovery, consumption, and governance of APIs, regardless of their type, lifecycle stage, or deployment location.

item.title: Azure Governance Update - Management Groups
item.description: Beginning May 3, 2024, Azure will start enabling the root management group for tenants that have not enabled it yet. Using Azure management groups leverages best practices when applying Azure Policy and having it pre-enabled reduces the initial set up work to follow the best practices.

atom:content.#text: Beginning May 3, 2024, Azure will start enabling the root management group for tenants that have not enabled it yet. Using Azure management groups leverages best practices when applying Azure Policy and having it pre-enabled reduces the initial set up work to follow the best practices.

item.title: General availability: Mexico Central region added to Azure HDInsight
item.description: HDInsight is now generally available in Mexico Central.  Azure HDInsight is a managed, full-spectrum, open-source analytics service in the cloud for enterprises. You can use open-source frameworks such as Hadoop, Apache Spark, Apache Hive, LLAP, Apache Kafka, and more. For more information about HDInsight, see the Azure HDInsight documentation.

atom:content.#text: HDInsight is now generally available in Mexico Central.  Azure HDInsight is a managed, full-spectrum, open-source analytics service in the cloud for enterprises. You can use open-source frameworks such as Hadoop, Apache Spark, Apache Hive, LLAP, Apache Kafka, and more. For more information about HDInsight, see the Azure HDInsight documentation.

item.title: Public Preview: Azure HDInsight on AKS is now available for preview in 7 new regions
item.description: Azure HDInsight on AKS is now available for preview in seven new regions - East US 2 EUAP, West US, Japan East, Australia East, Canada Central, North Europe, Brazil South. Azure HDInsight on AKS is a modern, reliable, secure, and fully managed Platform as a Service (PaaS) that runs on Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS). HDInsight on AKS allows you to deploy popular Open-Source Analytics workloads like Apache Spark™, Apache Flink®️, and Trino without the overhead of managing and monitoring containers. For more information about Azure HDInsight on AKS, see the documentation.

atom:content.#text: Azure HDInsight on AKS is now available for preview in seven new regions - East US 2 EUAP, West US, Japan East, Australia East, Canada Central, North Europe, Brazil South. Azure HDInsight on AKS is a modern, reliable, secure, and fully managed Platform as a Service (PaaS) that runs on Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS). HDInsight on AKS allows you to deploy popular Open-Source Analytics workloads like Apache Spark™, Apache Flink®️, and Trino without the overhead of managing and monitoring containers. For more information about Azure HDInsight on AKS, see the documentation.

item.title: General availability: HBv4-series & HX-series VMs are now available in Sweden Central.
item.description: HBv4 virtual machines (VMs) are optimized for various HPC workloads such as computational fluid dynamics, finite element analysis, frontend and backend EDA, rendering, molecular dynamics, computational geoscience, weather simulation, and financial risk analysis.  HX-series Virtual Machines (VMs) are optimized for large memory HPC workloads such as backend EDA, finite element analysis, computational geoscience, and big data analytics.

item.title: Azure Machine Learning data collector is now generally available
item.description: Azure Machine Learning data collector provides real-time logging of input and output data from models that are deployed to managed online endpoints or Kubernetes online endpoints. This data can be seamlessly used for model monitoring, debugging, or auditing, thereby providing observability into the performance of your deployed models.

atom:content.#text: Azure Machine Learning data collector provides real-time logging of input and output data from models that are deployed to managed online endpoints or Kubernetes online endpoints. This data can be seamlessly used for model monitoring, debugging, or auditing, thereby providing observability into the performance of your deployed models.

item.title: GA: Azure Monitor log search alerts support managed identities
item.description: A common challenge for developers is the management of credentials for applications to use when connecting to resources. Managed identities provide an automatically managed identity in Microsoft Entra ID. Applications can use managed identities to obtain Microsoft Entra tokens without having to manage any credentials.

atom:content.#text: A common challenge for developers is the management of credentials for applications to use when connecting to resources. Managed identities provide an automatically managed identity in Microsoft Entra ID. Applications can use managed identities to obtain Microsoft Entra tokens without having to manage any credentials.

item.title: Announcing Public Preview of Query editor in Azure Monitor Metrics
item.description:
Public Preview of Query editor in Azure Monitor Metrics is now Available!
Get started with Query editor to access advanced querying capabilities within Azure Monitor Metrics. With the Query Editor's seamless integration of the widely adopted Prometheus Query Language (PromQL), customers can unlock advanced querying capabilities within their Azure Monitor Workspace. With PromQL, you can now efficiently analyze Prometheus metrics, identify trends, troubleshoot issues, and optimize resource utilization for better performance and reliability.

atom:content.#text:
Public Preview of Query editor in Azure Monitor Metrics is now Available!
Get started with Query editor to access advanced querying capabilities within Azure Monitor Metrics. With the Query Editor's seamless integration of the widely adopted Prometheus Query Language (PromQL), customers can unlock advanced querying capabilities within their Azure Monitor Workspace. With PromQL, you can now efficiently analyze Prometheus metrics, identify trends, troubleshoot issues, and optimize resource utilization for better performance and reliability.

item.title: General Availability of Azure Logic Apps connectors for IBM Mainframe and Midranges
item.description: Exciting news! Our IBM Mainframe and Midrange connectors, including IBM 3270, IBM CICS, IBM DB2, IBM i, IBM MQ, and IBM IMS, are now generally available. These connectors address highly sought-after customer requests, bring capabilities to extend Azure Logic Apps cloud native workloads with some of the oldest systems ever built for Mainframes and Midranges.

atom:content.#text: Exciting news! Our IBM Mainframe and Midrange connectors, including IBM 3270, IBM CICS, IBM DB2, IBM i, IBM MQ, and IBM IMS, are now generally available. These connectors address highly sought-after customer requests, bring capabilities to extend Azure Logic Apps cloud native workloads with some of the oldest systems ever built for Mainframes and Midranges.

item.title: Public Preview of Azure OpenAI and AI Search in-app connectors for Logic Apps (Standard)
item.description: We're thrilled to announce two new built-in connectors for Azure Logic Apps: Azure OpenAI and Azure AI Search. With the increasing adoption of AI technologies, there's a growing demand to integrate these capabilities seamlessly into Logic Apps workflows. To address this need, we're launching the Public Preview of these connectors, bridging the gap between Logic Apps and AI.

atom:content.#text: We're thrilled to announce two new built-in connectors for Azure Logic Apps: Azure OpenAI and Azure AI Search. With the increasing adoption of AI technologies, there's a growing demand to integrate these capabilities seamlessly into Logic Apps workflows. To address this need, we're launching the Public Preview of these connectors, bridging the gap between Logic Apps and AI.

item.title: Announcing General Availability of Azure API Management Basic v2 and Standard v2 Tiers
item.description: We're thrilled to announce the General Availability of Azure API Management's newest pricing tiers – Basic v2 and Standard v2. The Azure API Management v2 pricing tiers represent a significant leap forward, offering a comprehensive range of capabilities tailored to projects of all sizes, from small-scale endeavors to large-scale enterprise applications. Importantly, these new v2 pricing tiers are available alongside our existing Azure API Management classic pricing tiers, ensuring continuity for users. It's worth noting that the Azure API Management classic pricing tiers remain actively supported and invested in.

atom:content.#text: We're thrilled to announce the General Availability of Azure API Management's newest pricing tiers – Basic v2 and Standard v2. The Azure API Management v2 pricing tiers represent a significant leap forward, offering a comprehensive range of capabilities tailored to projects of all sizes, from small-scale endeavors to large-scale enterprise applications. Importantly, these new v2 pricing tiers are available alongside our existing Azure API Management classic pricing tiers, ensuring continuity for users. It's worth noting that the Azure API Management classic pricing tiers remain actively supported and invested in.

item.title: GA: Azure API Management Developer Portal Unveils Enhanced Features for Increased Developer Productivity
item.description: The API Management developer portal is an automatically generated, fully customizable website with the documentation of your APIs. It's where API consumers can discover your APIs, learn how to use them, request access, and try them out. We recently improved the portal editor interface to boost your productivity and enhance the interactions with your favorite features and tools.

atom:content.#text: The API Management developer portal is an automatically generated, fully customizable website with the documentation of your APIs. It's where API consumers can discover your APIs, learn how to use them, request access, and try them out. We recently improved the portal editor interface to boost your productivity and enhance the interactions with your favorite features and tools.

item.title: General availability: Rate Limiting on ExpressRoute Direct Circuits
item.description: Rate Limiting is now generally available over ExpressRoute Direct port circuits, providing enhanced control over bandwidth usage. This Quality of Service (QoS) feature prevents circuits from bursting beyond their configured bandwidth, thereby improving network performance and reliability. Rate Limiting can be enabled for each circuit individually, offering flexibility to prioritize certain circuits. This feature can be activated during or after the creation of the ExpressRoute Direct circuit.

atom:content.#text: Rate Limiting is now generally available over ExpressRoute Direct port circuits, providing enhanced control over bandwidth usage. This Quality of Service (QoS) feature prevents circuits from bursting beyond their configured bandwidth, thereby improving network performance and reliability. Rate Limiting can be enabled for each circuit individually, offering flexibility to prioritize certain circuits. This feature can be activated during or after the creation of the ExpressRoute Direct circuit.

item.title: Breaking Changes to Azure API Management Workspaces
item.description:
As part of our commitment to enhancing workspaces (in Public Preview) within Azure API Management, we are implementing several critical breaking changes effective June 14, 2024. These changes are designed to streamline functionality and improve overall performance.  

These breaking changes will be effective from June 14, 2024. We strongly advise making any necessary adjustments to your workspace configurations before this date to ensure uninterrupted service.

item.title: Basic and Standard A-series VMs on HDInsight will retire on 31 August 2024
item.description:
On 31 August 2024, Azure will retire Basic and Standard A-series VMs as announced earlier on 24 August 2021.

Before 31 August 2024, you need to migrate your HDInsight A series VMs to Av2-series VMs, which provide more memory per vCPU and faster storage on solid-state drives (SSDs). To avoid service disruptions, migrate your workloads from Basic and Standard A-series VMs to Av2-series VMs before 31 August 2024.

atom:content.#text:
On 31 August 2024, Azure will retire Basic and Standard A-series VMs as announced earlier on 24 August 2021.

Before 31 August 2024, you need to migrate your HDInsight A series VMs to Av2-series VMs, which provide more memory per vCPU and faster storage on solid-state drives (SSDs). To avoid service disruptions, migrate your workloads from Basic and Standard A-series VMs to Av2-series VMs before 31 August 2024.

item.description: With the integration of Azure Data Lake Storage and the DICOM service, organizations can now enjoy full control over their imaging data and increased flexibility for accessing and working with that data through the Azure storage ecosystem and APIs.

atom:content.#text: With the integration of Azure Data Lake Storage and the DICOM service, organizations can now enjoy full control over their imaging data and increased flexibility for accessing and working with that data through the Azure storage ecosystem and APIs.

item.title: Operator and CRD support with Azure Managed Prometheus
item.description: Azure Monitor managed service for Prometheus will support CRD-based configs for scrape jobs to collect metrics from workloads running in your AKS cluster. With this new update, customers can use custom resources (service monitor and pod monitor) to configure metric collection with Managed Prometheus.

atom:content.#text: Azure Monitor managed service for Prometheus will support CRD-based configs for scrape jobs to collect metrics from workloads running in your AKS cluster. With this new update, customers can use custom resources (service monitor and pod monitor) to configure metric collection with Managed Prometheus.

item.title: Microsoft open sources Retina: A cloud-native container networking observability platform
item.description: The Microsoft's Azure Container Networking team is announcing Retina, a cloud-native container networking observability platform that enables Kubernetes users, admins, and developers to visualize, observe, debug, and analyze Kubernetes’ workload traffic irrespective of Container Network Interface (CNI), operating system (OS), and cloud.

atom:content.#text: The Microsoft's Azure Container Networking team is announcing Retina, a cloud-native container networking observability platform that enables Kubernetes users, admins, and developers to visualize, observe, debug, and analyze Kubernetes’ workload traffic irrespective of Container Network Interface (CNI), operating system (OS), and cloud.

item.title: Billing for Azure Monitor stateful log search alerts
item.description: Starting from May 1, 2024, you will be charged for stateful log alerts in Azure Monitor.

atom:content.#text: Starting from May 1, 2024, you will be charged for stateful log alerts in Azure Monitor.

item.title: Public preview: Kubernetes AI Toolchain Operator (KAITO) add-on for AKS
item.description: You can now choose from preset LLMs with images hosted by AKS and split inferencing across multiple lower-GPU count VMs

atom:content.#text: You can now choose from preset LLMs with images hosted by AKS and split inferencing across multiple lower-GPU count VMs

item.title: Generally Available: Cost analysis add-on for AKS
item.description: You can now better understand the infra costs associated with running applications at the namespace and cluster levels and identify opportunities to optimize resource utilization through an Azure native experience.

atom:content.#text: You can now better understand the infra costs associated with running applications at the namespace and cluster levels and identify opportunities to optimize resource utilization through an Azure native experience.

item.title: Open-Source Fleet Workload Placement Scheduling and Override
item.description: You can now schedule workloads in Fleet based on cost and availability of resource heuristics.

atom:content.#text: You can now schedule workloads in Fleet based on cost and availability of resource heuristics.

item.title: Generally Available: Windows Gen 2 VM support in AKS
item.description: YOu can now use Gen 2 VM SKUs for Windows nodepools in AKS.

atom:content.#text: YOu can now use Gen 2 VM SKUs for Windows nodepools in AKS.

item.title: Public preview: Windows GPU support in AKS
item.description: You can now run GPU workloads, such as machine learning, video encoding, large simulations, and gaming, on Windows nodepools in AKS.

atom:content.#text: You can now run GPU workloads, such as machine learning, video encoding, large simulations, and gaming, on Windows nodepools in AKS.

item.title: Generally Available: Kubernetes 1.29 support in AKS
item.description: You can now take advantage of Kubernetes 1.29 version with AKS in production environment.

atom:content.#text: You can now take advantage of Kubernetes 1.29 version with AKS in production environment.

item.title: Generally Available: Custom kubelet configuration for Windows in AKS
item.description: You can now modify default values for kubelet parameters when using Windows nodepools in AKS.

atom:content.#text: You can now modify default values for kubelet parameters when using Windows nodepools in AKS.

item.title: Public preview: Azure CNI static block IP allocation support in AKS
item.description: You can now scale beyond the current 65k Pod IPs and scale up to 1 Million Pods.

atom:content.#text: You can now scale beyond the current 65k Pod IPs and scale up to 1 Million Pods.

item.title: Public preview: Deployment safeguards in AKS
item.description: You can now use deployment safeguards to implement Kubernetes best practices and get warnings on deployment or deny the deployment of manifest files that are not following best practices.

atom:content.#text: You can now use deployment safeguards to implement Kubernetes best practices and get warnings on deployment or deny the deployment of manifest files that are not following best practices.

item.title: Generally Available: Azure CNI overlay dual stack Support in AKS (Linux only)
item.description: You can now deploy AKS clusters in dual stack mode which now enables resource connection through IPv4 or IPv6.

atom:content.#text: You can now deploy AKS clusters in dual stack mode which now enables resource connection through IPv4 or IPv6.

item.title: Generally Available: VM IP based load balancer in AKS
item.description: You can now choose IP-based backend pool membership for new or existing clusters in AKS.

atom:content.#text: You can now choose IP-based backend pool membership for new or existing clusters in AKS.

item.title: Generally Available: Host Network Security Group (NSG) control in AKS
item.description: You can now directly configure allowed ports in your nodepool settings.

atom:content.#text: You can now directly configure allowed ports in your nodepool settings.

item.title: Generally Available: HostPort auto assign in AKS
item.description: AKS now lets you deploy pods without manually specifying host ports.

atom:content.#text: AKS now lets you deploy pods without manually specifying host ports.

item.title: Generally Available: Instance level Public IP tags in AKS
item.description: You can now utilize Azure routing preference for your cluster, public node IPs in AKS

atom:content.#text: You can now utilize Azure routing preference for your cluster, public node IPs in AKS

item.title: Public preview: Trusted launch support in AKS
item.description: Administrators can now deploy AKS nodes with verified and signed bootloaders, OS kernels, and drivers.

atom:content.#text: Administrators can now deploy AKS nodes with verified and signed bootloaders, OS kernels, and drivers.

item.title: Generally Available: Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS) support for 5K Node limit by default for standard tier clusters
item.description: You can now scale your AKS cluster to larger than 1000 nodes without having to request any special limit increases or whitelisting.

atom:content.#text: You can now scale your AKS cluster to larger than 1000 nodes without having to request any special limit increases or whitelisting.

item.title: Public preview: Azure Modeling and Simulation Workbench
item.description: Azure Modeling and Simulation Workbench is a new service that provides a fully managed work environment for engineering development, accelerating project startup, and enabling secure collaboration between development teams.

atom:content.#text: Azure Modeling and Simulation Workbench is a new service that provides a fully managed work environment for engineering development, accelerating project startup, and enabling secure collaboration between development teams.

item.title: Azure Monitor managed service for Prometheus is available in 13 additional Azure regions
item.description: Azure Managed Prometheus was announced GA in May 2023 and was available in 26 regions, with this new update Azure Managed Prometheus will be available in 13 additional regions.

atom:content.#text: Azure Managed Prometheus was announced GA in May 2023 and was available in 26 regions, with this new update Azure Managed Prometheus will be available in 13 additional regions.

item.title: You can now opt in automatically renew your reservation at time of purchase.
item.description: You can now opt in automatically renew your reservation at time of purchase, which provides an easy way to continue getting reservation discounts.

atom:content.#text: You can now opt in automatically renew your reservation at time of purchase, which provides an easy way to continue getting reservation discounts.

item.title: Azure Classic Administrator roles are retiring on 31 August 2024
item.description: On 31 August 2024, Azure classic administrator roles will be retired. Transition from Azure Classic Administrator roles to RBAC roles

atom:content.#text: On 31 August 2024, Azure classic administrator roles will be retired. Transition from Azure Classic Administrator roles to RBAC roles

item.title: Visual Studio App Center retirement
item.description: Visual Studio App Center is scheduled for retirement on March 31, 2025.

atom:content.#text: Visual Studio App Center is scheduled for retirement on March 31, 2025.

item.title: Retirement: Support for Application Gateway Web Application Firewall v2 Configuration is ending
item.description: On 15 March 2027, the Application Gateway WAF v2 Configuration will be retired. To continue using this service, switch to the Application Gateway WAF v2 Policy before the retirement date.

atom:content.#text: On 15 March 2027, the Application Gateway WAF v2 Configuration will be retired. To continue using this service, switch to the Application Gateway WAF v2 Policy before the retirement date.

item.title: Azure Monitor managed service for Prometheus now supports TLS & mTLS based scraping
item.description: Azure Monitor managed service for Prometheus now supports TLS & mTLS based scraping for Prometheus instance served with TLS. To enable TLS and mTLS based scraping, you can configure the TLS settings in the ConfigMap.

atom:content.#text: Azure Monitor managed service for Prometheus now supports TLS & mTLS based scraping for Prometheus instance served with TLS. To enable TLS and mTLS based scraping, you can configure the TLS settings in the ConfigMap.

item.title: Azure IoT Edge supports Ubuntu Core Snaps
item.description: We are expanding the Azure IoT Edge supported platforms to include Ubuntu Core Snaps on IoT Edge as a Tier 1 supported operating system.

atom:content.#text: We are expanding the Azure IoT Edge supported platforms to include Ubuntu Core Snaps on IoT Edge as a Tier 1 supported operating system.

item.title: Now available: Free data transfer out to internet when leaving Azure
item.description: Learn how to qualify for free egress when moving your data out of Azure.

item.title: Public Preview: JVM memory fit in Azure Container Apps
item.description: Java apps are now attuned to the container environment and primed for better performance and reliability by default.

atom:content.#text: Java apps are now attuned to the container environment and primed for better performance and reliability by default.

item.title: Public Preview: Managed Java components in Azure Container Apps
item.description: You can now leverage managed Java components in Azure Container apps for service registry and externalized application properties.

atom:content.#text: You can now leverage managed Java components in Azure Container apps for service registry and externalized application properties.

item.title: Public Preview: Tomcat support in Azure Container Apps

item.title: Public Preview: Modernizing Azure Resource Manager Throttling
item.description: In 2024, Azure Resource Manager is introducing a revamped throttling experience for subscriptions, with increased limits and a token bucket algorithm for managing requests. This will enhance API management and improve productivity. The transition to the new architecture will be gradual, leading to a more efficient and dynamic throttling experience. For more information, consult the Azure Resource Manager documentation.

atom:content.#text: In 2024, Azure Resource Manager is introducing a revamped throttling experience for subscriptions, with increased limits and a token bucket algorithm for managing requests. This will enhance API management and improve productivity. The transition to the new architecture will be gradual, leading to a more efficient and dynamic throttling experience. For more information, consult the Azure Resource Manager documentation.

item.description: Public preview enhancements and updates released for Azure SQL in mid-March 2024.

atom:content.#text: Public preview enhancements and updates released for Azure SQL in mid-March 2024.

item.title: General Availability: Azure Defender for Microsoft Azure Database for PostgreSQL - Flexible Server
item.description: Defender for Cloud detects anomalous activities indicating unusual and potentially harmful attempts to access or exploit databases. When deployed, it provides another important security barrier.
